The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna
The Elder Āyāgadāyaka’s Birth Story
“When the Lord of the World had passed away,🔽in the Sīha era, the best of speakers,
with a mind full of joy,
I worshipped the supreme monument.
Having had it measured by builders,
and having given the price then,
with a mind full of joy,
I had the offering made.🔽For eight eons I lived
among the gods without interruption;
In the remaining eons,
I wandered through rebirths with interruption.
Poison does not affect my body,
and weapons do not harm me;
I do not drown in water,
this is the fruit of the offering.
If I wish for rain,
a great cloud rains down;
Even the gods are under my control,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.
Endowed with the seven treasures,
I was a wheel-turning monarch thirty times;
No one disrespects me,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.
